Okay, then roll on with it! We can assume that Nightshift, Tuscon and
Straightshot were away from Cybertron, perhaps even on their way to
Earth when those events transpired.

Sounds good to me.
- Preston

On 10/28/11, Sandy Panico <magicquartz@...> wrote:
> I like the idea that Tucson, Nightshift and Straight Shot are not aware of
> Yoketron's death, that would make it interesting. I think I'd like to roll
> with that.
>
> Perpetually on the move and constantly busy.
>
> On Oct 28, 2011, at 12:19 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...>
> wrote:
>
>> Basically I am using a lot of the animated events in the background
>> events of Cybertron. Basically the world went from G1/G2 to Animated
>> to Beast Wars back on old Earth - Beast Machines never happened.
>>
>> So for Yokatron: (Yes I am stealing the name Prowl-Z from Adam for the
>> name of the animated version of Prowl, I hope he doesn't mind)
>>
>> ***************
>> Yoketron is a wise old Autobot responsible for training the Autobot
>> Cyber-Ninja Corps at the Cyber-Ninja Dojo, but more importantly, he
>> protects the Autobots' cache of protoforms, which will have to be
>> activated if Project Omega fails. He is a master of many martial arts,
>> including Circuit-Su, Metallikato, Crystalocution, diffusion,
>> Tekkaido, Tahtib-tron and Laser Lathi.
>>
>> One of Yoketron's former students, Lockdown, betrayed him, stealing
>> most of the protoforms for the Decepticons, and leaving Yoketron to
>> die. Prowl-Z returned during the aftermath, and he attempted to revive
>> Yoketron by transferring his spark to a protoform that had been left
>> behind. Though Yoketron formed from the new Protoform, Yoketron
>> chastised Prowl-Z for not accepting fate, telling him he "...must not
>> sacrifice a piece of the future to bring back the past." As he told
>> Prowl-Z that he would understand when his time came, Yoketron
>> relinquished his spark, and his new body grayed.
>> **************
>>
>> So yes Yoketron is dead, killed by Lockdown, however that leaves
>> several things open - In who's employ was Lockdown, it could easily
>> have been BLUDGEON. The manner of Yoketron's death has been kept from
>> the public at large. In fact I would imagine that the story is that
>> since he was considered old, that he sucummed to the ravages of time.
>> MOST PEOPLE BELIEVE THIS STORY.
>>
>> I am unsure at what point Tuscon and Nightshift left the Dojo and came
>> to Earth, so he may not be aware that Yoketron is dead, or if he is,
>> he may not know how. I will leave that up to Sandy how much Tuscon and
>> Nightshift know and how much they may have told Straight Shot.
>>
>> However the revelation that Bludgeon could have been behind it, or
>> even part of of it at all would be new knowledge. Most will not have
>> any knowledge unless they have some special connection to someone who
>> was in on matters, or was in it themselves.
>>
>> I invite questions and/or comments.
>>
>> - Preston
>>
>
